thread.title: RPD arrest speeding driver after chase using road spikes
thread.title_full: RPD arrest speeding driver after chase using road spikes

author: Staff reports
title: RPD arrest speeding driver after chase using road spikes
text:
The driver in a car that was reported stolen has been taken into custody after Rochester Police officers engaged in a vehicle pursuit late Sunday afternoon. The chase traveled through streets in northeast Rochester, ending near the intersection of N. Goodman Street and College Avenue in the Neighborhood of the Arts. "The sole occupant of the vehicle was taken into custody," the RPD said in a press release. It also stated that the "Rochester Police Officers chased a vehicle that was taken during a robbery in the city a couple of days ago. Officers attempted to pull the vehicle over on Central Park in the city and the vehicle failed to comply with the officer’s emergency lights and siren." Here is audio from the chase. This was the 2nd time today the driver led officers on a high speed chase. #roc https://t.co/IpVUyZpnw9
— MonroeCountyFireWire (@mcfw) October 12, 2015 At one point spike strips were deployed onto a Rochester street in an attempt to limit the car's mobility by flattening the car's tires and slowing it down. The driver was transported to Rochester General Hospital as a precautionary measure where he is expected to be treated and released. The RPD statement also stated that "Upon the driver’s release the suspect will be interviewed by investigators. There were no injuries to officers or any civilians during the pursuit. The investigation is ongoing at this time."
Earlier Sunday, at approximately 2 p.m., RPD reported that "Rochester Police Officers attempted to pull over a stolen vehicle on Lyell Avenue. After a short vehicle pursuit, officers lost sight of the vehicle in the area of the interchange of Routes 490 and 590."
Brian Sharp, bdsharp@Gannett.com, contributed to this report.
